items.title: Queensland's fluoride fear to leave lasting impact on dental health for generations to come
items.summary: Many people would say the benefits of fluoride in water are clear but in this state it's often not there and there will be lasting health impacts.

items.title: UCI Track Cycling World Championships in Chile aims to bring velodrome racing back in from the cold
items.summary: As the UCI Track Cycling World Championships get underway at the Velódromo de Peñalolén in Santiago this week, the Australian team aims to overcome its geographical limitations and lack of racing to claim gold.

items.title: How Boomers deal with big paydays and LeBron's possible last season among five things to watch as NBA returns
items.summary: Two young Aussies have gotten paid, teams continue to plot to take down the Thunder and LeBron's future continues to be a talking point. Here are five things to keep an eye on as the NBA season gets underway.

items.summary: Anthony Albanese has downplayed Donald Trump's declaration that does not like Kevin Rudd "and probably never will". Follow live.

items.title: Millions of red crabs begin annual migration on Christmas Island as numbers 'skyrocket'

items.title: Unsuccessful independent's $2m election campaign spend highest in Australia
items.summary: An MP says new donation caps on political groups such as Climate 200 mean the days of independents spending up to $2 million on election campaigns are "gone".

items.title: Mark Nawaqanitawase becomes dual international as Kangaroos name Ashes Test squad
items.summary: Ex-Wallabies winger Mark Nawaqanitawase and Reece Walsh are among four players named to make their debuts for Australia in the opening Ashes rugby league Test against England.

items.title: Access to road accident compensation for Indigenous Australians is falling short, study says
items.summary: A first-of-its-kind South Australian study finds access to compensation after a road accident is not good enough for First Nations people.

items.title: Louvre robbery not the first to resemble a heist film this century

items.title: Electrical apprentices exposed to potentially deadly shocks due to lack of training, union says
items.summary: One in eight electrical apprentices are being exposed to potentially deadly shocks at work, as the industry struggles with worker shortages, inadequate support and delays in training.

items.title: AUKUS architect says concerns remain over deal's future despite Donald Trump backing
items.summary: The federal government is celebrating the US president's emphatic backing of AUKUS, saying his statements should kill off speculation.

items.title: A survivor of the digital wave and Parramatta's growth, independent record store celebrates 30 years
items.summary: Tucked away at the end of an old arcade strip, a local record store has survived three decades of change, from new technology to the construction of Sydney's second CBD.

items.title: Industry warns building houses in Australia slower than it was a decade ago, construction targets missed

items.title: Canberra man on trial for raping teenage girl calls co-accused a 'liar' in ACT Supreme Court

items.summary: Locals flock to waterholes and outback pubs to escape the heat, as temperatures soar to the mid-40s.

items.title: Brittany Higgins drops appeal against former WA Senator Linda Reynolds's defamation win
items.summary: Brittany Higgins abandons her appeal of a WA Supreme Court finding that she defamed her ex-boss and former Liberal Senator Linda Reynolds in a series of social media posts.

items.title: Rex Airlines finds US buyer after entering into voluntary administration

items.title: Senator Nampijinpa Price civil trial hears land council CEO's reputation took a 'sustained hit' after media coverage

items.title: Queensland police called in to investigate after five people hospitalised from rat poison

items.title: Myanmar military detains more than 2,000 people in cybercrime centre raid

items.title: Sanae Takaichi becomes Japan's first female PM, but some say it is not a win for women

items.title: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy maintains his innocence on way to prison

items.title: Rockhampton's Fitzroy River passes initial testing to host 2032 Olympic events

items.summary: Donald Trump and Anthony Albanese have inked a deal for "critical mineral and energy dominance" in a new partnership that will tip billions into mining projects in the US and Australia.

items.summary: An oil painting of an enormous bull is the star attraction at a regional Australian gallery. How did the genre of massive livestock art become so popular?

items.summary: This latest heist at the Louvre highlights the vulnerability of objects in public collections. The irony is they are often gifted to such institutions for safekeeping.

items.summary: The lamb is fuss-free and full of flavour. No barbecue needed — the oven takes care of everything.

items.title: Mobile coverage is an election issue in regional areas. What's been promised?

items.summary: The Reserve Bank of Australia is a step closer to its biggest restructure in three decades after the treasurer offers an assurance to his Coalition counterpart.
